name: Methane
safetyNotes: Highly flammable; odorless (mercaptan added for leak detection); lighter than air (rises); asphyxiant in confined spaces; explosive when 5-15% in air
educationalNotes: Boiling point -161.5°C - methane is a gas at all normal Earth temperatures! Must be cooled to -161.5°C or compressed to liquefy. Simplest hydrocarbon (one carbon atom). Main component of natural gas (~95%). Major greenhouse gas (25× more potent than CO₂ over 100 years).
